# StockFlow

> A modern inventory management system for businesses to track products, orders, and transactions.

## Overview

StockFlow is a full-stack MERN application that provides comprehensive inventory management capabilities. Built with React, Node.js, Express, and MongoDB.

## Key Features

- User authentication with JWT tokens
- Role-based access control (Admin, Manager, Staff)
- Product management with categories
- Order tracking and management
- Transaction history and analytics
- Dashboard with key metrics
- RESTful API architecture

## Tech Stack

- Frontend: React 18, TailwindCSS, Axios, React Router
- Backend: Node.js 18+, Express.js 4.x
- Database: MongoDB with Mongoose ODM
- Auth: JWT with bcryptjs password hashing
- Validation: express-validator
- Logging: morgan

## API Endpoints

### Authentication
- POST /users/register - Create new user account
- POST /users/login - Authenticate and receive JWT

### Products
- GET /products - List all products
- GET /products/:id - Get product by ID
- POST /products - Create product (Admin/Manager)
- PUT /products/:id - Update product (Admin/Manager)
- DELETE /products/:id - Delete product (Admin only)

### Categories
- GET /categories - List all categories
- POST /categories - Create category
- PUT /categories/:id - Update category
- DELETE /categories/:id - Delete category

### Orders
- GET /orders - List all orders
- POST /orders - Create order
- PUT /orders/:id - Update order
- DELETE /orders/:id - Delete order

### Transactions
- GET /transactions - List all transactions
- GET /transactions/analytics/total-turnover - Get total revenue
- POST /transactions - Create transaction

### Health
- GET /health - API health check

## Repository Structure

- /backend - Express.js API server
- /frontend - React application
- /backend/models - MongoDB schemas
- /backend/controllers - Request handlers
- /backend/routes - API route definitions
- /frontend/src/pages - React page components
- /frontend/src/components - Reusable UI components
- /frontend/src/services - API service layer

## Quick Start

```bash
# Clone repository
git clone https://github.com/Priyans-hu/StockFlow.git

# Backend setup
cd StockFlow/backend
cp .env.example .env
npm install
npm run dev

# Frontend setup
cd ../frontend
npm install
npm start
```
